title: Welcome To My Blog

title: Luca Modica
text:
Hello there! My name is Luca Modica.
I am a fellow researcher for the Social Computing group at the University of Turin. Also thanks to my bachelor‚Äôs thesis, I have interests in social computing and HCI, in particular the gamification of platforms.
My current dream is to became a machine learning engineer / AI researcher, while exploring the world. For this reason, I will pursue a Master‚Äôs Degree in Data Science and AI at the Chalmers University of Technology, G√∂teborg.

title: Luca Modica
text:
I‚Äôm Luca Modica, full-stack developer and aspirant machine learning engineer / AI researcher, graduated at University of Turin in Computer Science. üë®üèª‚Äçüíª
Also thanks to my thesis, I expand my topic of interest to social computing and HCI, in particular about the gamification of platforms üïπÔ∏è (check out my bachelor‚Äôs thesis work here!).
My current dream is to intersect these topics with my recent passion in artificial intelligence, in particular about SOTA neural networks üß† (Kaggle profile here).

title: üí≠Luca Modica
text:
‚ú®Interest

üß† Addicted by code, amazed by AI and affascinated by data science
üçª Food&Beer lover (just give me a stout and Sicilian food and I will be happy)
üê∂ Owner of a doggo (mine rocks an awesome beard :D)
üìñ Average book enjoyer.

I have a secret love for penguins. Below you will find a scatterplot of three of the many species, as a sign of appreciation. üíìüêß


Code
import seaborn as sns
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
g = sns.FacetGrid(sns.load_dataset('penguins'), hue='species', height=3, aspect=3.5/1.5)
g.map(plt.scatter, 'bill_length_mm', 'bill_depth_mm').add_legend()

calm being who love cultivating his passions and excited to share, work and hang out with others
INSERT PERSONALITY and great open source supporter. I believe open source nowdays is crucial to live in a world with AI safety, rather than falling in an Age of Dislightenment.

title: Luca Modica
text:
Projects
In my free time I usually read, go outside jogging, play videogames and also do some random coding. You can find most of my code project and experiments in my Github page and Kaggle profile.
